docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 30 (AP) -- America marched undefeated into the final series of the Olympic basketball tournament today but it was a close squeak.
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, July 30 (AP) -- America marched undefeated into the final series of the Olympic basketball tournament today but it was a close squeak.

headline.main: U. S. QUINTET TAKES SIXTH IN ROW, 57-53; Americans Rally to Beat Brazil as Lovellette Excels -Russia Trims Chile
FETE HONORS URUGUAY I; Dinner Is Last of Series for 211 { South American Countries !

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 31 -The United States reached the final of the basketball tournament with Russia, and American swimmers and divers were among the top qualifiers with record-breaking performances today as the games of the Fifteenth Olympiad...
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, July 31 -The United States reached the final of the basketball tournament with Russia, and American swimmers and divers were among the top qualifiers with record-breaking performances today as the games of the Fifteenth Olympiad drew near the close of competition.

headline.main: U. S. Gains Basketball Final With Russia and Paces Olympic Swimming Trials; AMERICAN QUINTET BEATS ARGENTINA Lovellette Gets 25 Points in 85-76 Victory -- Russia Tops Uruguayan Five, 61-57 LEE FAR AHEAD IN DIVING Miss Kawamoto, Oyakawa and Holan of U. S. Set Olympic Marks in Swim Trials

byline.original: By ALLISON DANZIGSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 31 -- The United Nations Economic and Social Council this afternoon completed one of the most spirited debates during its three-month session, and sent to the General Assembly, without comment, a series of resolutions...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 31 -- The United Nations Economic and Social Council this afternoon completed one of the most spirited debates during its three-month session, and sent to the General Assembly, without comment, a series of resolutions submitted by the Commission on Human Rights concerning the future independence of nonself-governing peoples.

headline.main: PLEBISCITES ISSUE FOR U. N. ASSEMBLY; Economic and Social Council Votes 14 to 3 to Transmit Rights Report Directly

byline.original: By KATHLEEN McLAUGHLINSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 1 (UP) -- The Fourth Congress of the Pan-American sports committee voted today to hold the 1955 Pan-American games in Mexico City in March.
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 1 (UP) -- The Fourth Congress of the Pan-American sports committee voted today to hold the 1955 Pan-American games in Mexico City in March.
docs.abstract: Cong sports com meets; '55 games to Mex City; Gen J J Clark (Mexico) made com pres; A Brundage resigns as vp

headline.main: MEXICO CITY GETS GAMES; Fourth Pan-American Contests to Start in March, 1955

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 1 -- Major Sammy Lee of the Army Medical Corps and Yoshinobu Oyakawa, 18-year-old Hawaiian from Ohio State University, won two more Olympic gold medals for the United States in diving and swimming today to raise the total to...
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 1 -- Major Sammy Lee of the Army Medical Corps and Yoshinobu Oyakawa, 18-year-old Hawaiian from Ohio State University, won two more Olympic gold medals for the United States in diving and swimming today to raise the total to six thus far.

headline.main: Lee and Oyakawa Triumph as U. S. Gains 34 Points in Olympic Swim Events; DIVER ENDS CAREER BY RETAINING TITLE
NO PENALTY FOR FRACAS; Uruguayan in Basketball Fight Escapes Punishment

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 2 -- Once again the United States is the champion nation in the Olympic Games.
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 2 -- Once again the United States is the champion nation in the Olympic Games.

headline.main: RUSSIA OVERTAKEN; U. S. Beats Soviet Five, 36 to 25, and Gains Five Ring Titles SWEEPS WOMEN'S DIVING Konno Victor as Americans Take 56 1/2-Point Lead to Clinch Olympic Crown American-Soviet Harmony After Olympic Basketball Final -- A U. S. Boxer on Way to Championship AMERICANS CLINCH OLYMPIC HONORS

byline.original: By ALLISON DANZIGSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 2 (UP) -- An unpleasant Olympic incident was narrowly averted today when two suspended Uruguayan basketball players received their third place bronze medals with the rest of their team-mates and then had to give them back.
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 2 (UP) -- An unpleasant Olympic incident was narrowly averted today when two suspended Uruguayan basketball players received their third place bronze medals with the rest of their team-mates and then had to give them back.
docs.abstract: 2 Uruguayan players forced to return medals for attack on US referee

headline.main: 2 URUGUAYANS GET, THEN LOSE MEDALS; Members of Third-Place Five Were Suspended for Attack on Referee at Olympics
